posts.name: Henry Mahnke
posts.cooked: Hello, My team has been using our swerve drive, and though we are familiar with some drift of the swerve drive whether that’s because of the kinematics model, non-perfect magnet offsets, or something else that is more or less unavoidable, I’m wondering if teams have investigated using the turning input to change the setpoint for a rotation PID, therefore avoiding an analog input and instead using a feedback loop to control the rotation relative to the gyro angle, making it near perfect. Has anyone done this/ would it be worth investing time into?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: What do u mean exactly? The odometry should already be using the gyro.

posts.name: Tinnittin
posts.cooked: This is very common if not nearly universal for swerve drives. WPILib’s Holonomic Drive Controller requires this through a ProfiledPIDController. Holonomic Drive Controller — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: Holonomic Drive Controller — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Henry Mahnke
posts.cooked: Yes! We use this in auto, but is this ever used in teleop specifically for the holonomic rotation?

posts.name: Tinnittin
posts.cooked: Yes, our driver prefers to just control the rotational velocity of the robot similar to turning on a tank drive. You could also have the angle of one stick define the facing direction of the robot, or have auto alignment with a button for the d-pad to auto-face a specific direction.

posts.name: Jp
posts.cooked: Does anyone knows of any other teams that implement HolonomicDriveController for teleop?

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
